resources.string: while the app is counting correct and wrong readings for visual acuity score. The test will start from current row and enumerate up to 5 optotypes before moving to next row with smaller optotypes. The test is finished when more than {0} are misread in the same row or the last row is done.

resources.string: With {0} eyechart, swipe right to mark correct reading, and swipe left to mark misreading,
With {0} eyechart, swipe left, up, right or down according to what the testee could recognize and respond,
With {0} eyechart, swipe left, up-left, up, up-right, right, down-right, down or down-left according to what the testee could recognize and respond,
Unable to see the top row?
This app reassembles {0} through generating optotypes at exact physical sizes according to the test distance.
This app cannot replace optometrists who would carry out professional and comprehensive tests for your eyes. Please seek help from medical professional at early signs of visual acuity problems.

resources.string: During pause, swipe up to increase size, or swipe down to decrease size.
The app will speak the optotype. The “doctor” wearing an earphone knows what’s on without reading the optotype.
Minimum 0.5 meter, maximum 30 meters. The distance will appear in the Distance List.
Show the physical height of the optotype when moving to the other test row.
When the app is running on the screen, keep the screen of the mobile device on.
During Auto-scoring, the app will display next optotype after the defined interval. The app will mark a miss and move to next optotype if the “patient” could not respond on time within the interval.

Brightness setting independent of the device’s brightness setting. The device’s brightness setting is generally for viewing within an arm’s reach distance, while the app is generally for viewing from a distance longer than 2 meters, thus brighter white background is reasonable.
Record a score at the end of each eye test with Autoplay.
Rate this app on Google Play
If you find this app useful, please rate it.
Rate this app on App Store
Network connection is having some problem.

Visual acuity notations of Snellen Fractions 20/20, 5/5, or 6/6, and Decimal 1.0 refer to the reference standard. Equivalent notations include MAR 1.0, LogMAR 0 and Visual Acuity Score 100. “Normal” visual acuity for healthy eyes is 1 or 2 lines better than Decimal 1.0 or Visual Acuity Score 100. Visual Acuity Score (VAS) is more intuitive since higher integer values indicate better visual acuity. VAS value lower than 100 may indicate myopia, however, only optometrists or ophthalmologists can diagnose myopia or pseudo myopia. Early diagnosis and preventive measures may prevent pseudo myopia from becoming myopia, or prevent myopia from becoming worse. Checking visual acuity weekly, fortnightly or monthly may help early detection and diagnosis.
While you may record scores on paper or PMS, you may also use this app to record visual acuity scores. Please go to Settings and enable “Record Scores”.
Visual acuity scores of multiple testees could be recorded. Each testee may have 1 record a day for both eyes. Repeated tests on the same date will have the last one recorded.
